bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 185 (Wednesday, November 8, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. VELAZQUEZ:H.R. 6320.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8 of the United States Constitution,which gives Congress the power ``to make all Laws which shallbe necessary and proper for carrying into Execution theforegoing Powers and all other Powers vested by thisConstitution in the Government of the United States, or inany Department or Officer thereof.''The single subject of this legislation is:This legislation would clarify when federal agencies haveto utilize small businesses during federal procurements.[Page H5653]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

bill.title: Increase Small Business Utilization Act of 2023

item.title: Increase Small Business Utilization Act of 2023
Increase Small Business Utilization Act of 2023
To amend the Small Business Act to ensure the application of the "Rule of Two" to certain acquisitions, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
